Uxie and Silvally-Fairy are reliable pivots that can switch in Thwackey to safely set Grassy Terrain again or sweepers like Hitmonlee and Thievul to set up. With Grassy Terrain, Silvally-Steel appreciates the weakened Earthquake damage and passive recovery.

Sandaconda.overview: Sandaconda is able to serve as a consistent Stealth Rock user and Electric-immune Pokemon with its natural bulk and Shed Skin. With Shed Skin and Rest, Sandaconda is able to remain healthy throughout the game to check Pokemon like Passimian, Aggron, and Silvally-Steel. Sandaconda also provides speed control with Glare, making it less easy to take advantage of. Sandaconda's decent Speed and Attack mean it can even commit to a Coil set, although its typing and poor Special Defense leaves it forced out by tier staples like Whimsicott. However, Sandaconda still faces competition from Palossand as a Stealth Rock user and Electric-immune Pokemon, as it has more consistent recovery and better bulk. Shed Skin is also not consistent, making it unsafe to be overly dependent on Rest.

sets.name: Stealth Rock
sets.description: Sandaconda is able to cripple Pokemon it cannot touch with Earthquake like Mesprit and Archeops with Glare. Rest is able to keep Sandaconda healthy and is more reliable in combination with Shed Skin. Rocky Helmet allows Sandaconda to wear down Pokemon such as Togedemaru. Leftovers gives Sandaconda more sustainability, but it is often switching into Knock Off from Pokemon like Passimian and Absol anyway. The Speed investment allows Sandaconda to outspeed Adamant Aggron. Pokemon like Togedemaru and Lanturn are able to provide Wish and cleric support respectively so Sandaconda is less reliant on Shed Skin, and can sponge special attacks from Pokemon such as Ribombee and Charizard. In return, Sandaconda can switch into strong physical attackers like Lycanroc and Archeops. Wallbreakers such as Gallade and Magmortar are able to capitalize on Sandaconda spreading paralysis. Sandaconda can run Stone Edge over Glare to hit Flying-types like Archeops at the cost of providing less support.

Centiskorch.overview: Centiskorch makes for a great wallbreaker thanks to its fantastic movepool and great Attack, allowing it to beat most physically defensive walls and Fire-resistant Pokemon like Palossand, Gigalith, and Jellicent. Its ability Flash Fire, decent special bulk, and typing allow it to switch into threats like Magmortar and Ribombee, although its lack of recovery means it can't do so very often. However, Centiskorch's mediocre defensive typing, Speed, and Defense leave it susceptible to many faster threats like Absol, Archeops, Basculin, and Passimian, which also makes it harder to get it in the field safely.

sets.name: Wallbreaker
sets.description: Fire Lash makes Centiskorch harder to switch into, and it allows Centiskorch to get past defensive behemoths like Weezing and Palossand more easily. Power Whip hits Ground-, Rock-, and Water-types, and Knock Off allows Centiskorch to cripple foes reliant on their items. Due to its poor physical bulk, typing, and Speed, Centiskorch greatly appreciates teammates capable of bringing it in safely; Archeops, Togedemaru, and Ribombee are great examples, as they all appreciate it weakening down their answers like Gigalith. Basculin is another great example, as it enjoys Centiskorch softening up Jellicent. Answers to Flying-, Rock-, and Water-types like Charizard, Aggron, and Kabutops are greatly appreciated, as Centiskorch often finds itself forced out by them. This makes Regirock and Palossand great partners as they can also support it with their Stealth Rock, giving it an easier time wallbreaking.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description:
Due to its ability to boost its stats with Bulk Up as well as its access to semi-reliable recovery in Drain Punch, Grapploct can function as a solid wincon on balance teams while also being able to check physical attackers such as Morpeko. Brutal Swing allows Grapploct to hit Psychic- and Ghost-types such as Musharna and Gourgeist, whereas Sucker Punch gives it the ability to hit faster Pokemon such as Boltund as well as deal with offensive teams in general. The given HP and Defense investment lets Grapploct avoid the 2HKO from Life Orb Drednaw's Liquidation after Stealth Rock, while the Special Defense EVs let it take Modest Choice Specs Glaceon's Ice Beam after Stealth Rock.

Psychic-types such as Mr. Rime, Beheeyem, and Galarian Rapidash can handle Poison-types like Mareanie for Grapploct, while they in turn appreciate Grapploct's ability to handle Dark-types like Morpeko. Morpeko in turn aids Grapploct in dealing with Ghost- and Psychic-types, which Grapploct can struggle against while Beheeyem can provide slow momentum for Grapploct with Teleport. Entry hazard support from Pokemon such as Roselia and Stunfisk further aid Grapploct in wearing down foes. Fairy-types such as Galarian Rapidash and Shiinotic are difficult for Grapploct to deal with as well, so Pokemon such as Roselia, Drednaw, Mawile, and Flareon make for decent partners. Mawile and Pawniard also provide Knock Off support to weaken bulkier Pokemon such as Mareanie that can be problematic for Grapploct to handle. Healing Wish support from Pokemon such as Mr. Mime and Galarian Rapidash can provide Grapploct with a second chance to sweep.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
Hattrem is the tier's premier entry hazard deterrent due to its ability in Magic Bounce and Eviolite-boosted defenses, letting it pivot into entry hazard setters such as Mareanie, Roselia, and Stunfisk. Nuzzle makes offensive Pokemon that can eat a hit from Hattrem such as Galarian Rapidash and Unfezant think twice about switching in, since paralysis cripples them from effectively threatening a team. Healing Wish allows Hattrem to give powerful sweepers or wallbreakers such as Lilligant and Marowak a second opportunity to sweep or break an opponent's team. Lastly, Calm Mind assists Hattrem in breaking bulkier foes such as specially defensive Throh, specially defensive Klinklang, and Rest Stunfisk. The given spread maximizes Hattrem's bulk while allowing it to outspeed uninvested base 50 Speed Pokemon such as Mawile and Lickilicky.

While Hattrem serves as a deterrent for entry hazards, it is not guaranteed to keep them off its side of the field. With this in mind, entry hazard removers such as Sandslash and Silvally-Rock form a core with Hattrem that keeps entry hazards from chipping the team. Strong physical attackers such as Raboot and Unfezant appreciate Hattrem providing Healing Wish support and switching into their checks such as Stunfisk and Mareanie, blocking their entry hazards. Slower wallbreakers such as Marowak and Throh also appreciate the Healing Wish support that Hattrem provides, and if Hattrem is running Nuzzle, they appreciate being able to outspeed many more Pokemon thanks to them being paralyzed. Wish passers such as Lickilicky, Wigglytuff, and Flareon pair nicely with Hattrem, since they keep it healthy and allow it to maintain its ability to aggressively pivot into entry hazard setters throughout the match. Wigglytuff and Lickilicky are also able to check Ghost-types such as Dusknoir and Gourgeist for Hattrem by blocking Poltergeist. Hattrem's reliance on its Eviolite to maintain bulk means that it appreciates having partners that can absorb Knock Off for it such as Throh and Appletun.

Runerigus.overview: Runerigus is able to provide a fair amount of utility with its typing and ability to spread both status and entry hazards. It has the natural Defense to withstand strong attacks from Pokemon like Lycanroc and various Silvally formes. Runerigus is also capable of being a setup sweeper to become less passive and take advantage of Pokemon like Toxic Regirock expecting to just wear it down. However, its typing leaves it vulnerable to common wallbreakers like Tsareena and Froslass. It also faces heavy competition from Palossand, which has similar defensive qualities and reliable recovery, although it lacks Toxic Spikes and is generally more one-dimensional. Cofagrigus rivals Runerigus as a bulky setup sweeper with its typing and is better at keeping up Toxic Spikes, as it can safely spinblock Tsareena. However, Runerigus is able to fit Amnesia more easily.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description: Runerigus's bulk gives it a fair amount of opportunities to set up entry hazards against Pokemon like Archeops and Togedemaru. Leftovers provides passive recovery, while Colbur Berry lets Runerigus switch into Knock Off users like Passimian and Sawk comfortably. Earthquake hits Magmortar and Charizard using Roost, but Body Press can be used for more damage against switch-ins like Tsareena and Scrafty while still hitting typical Earthquake targets like Regirock and Gigalith. Will-O-Wisp cripples Archeops and deters Swords Dance Silvally formes. Toxic Spikes lets Runerigus spread more status and support setup sweepers like Charizard and Gallade. Poltergeist is an alternative to hit Pokemon like Whimsicott and Ribombee as well as opposing Ghost-types like Haunter. Rest gives Runerigus some form of recovery and pairs nicely with clerics like Aromatisse and Lanturn that can reliably beat special attackers such as Charizard and Magmortar that Runerigus struggles against. Aromatisse can also deal with Scrafty and provides Wish support for it.

sets.name: Bulky Setup Sweeper
sets.description: Runerigus is able to further push its defensive capabilities with Iron Defense and Amnesia to become a durable setup sweeper. Full Defense investment maximizes Body Press's power, but a specially defensive spread can be used to more comfortably boost against Galvantula and Charizard. Rest is Runerigus's only means of recovery and prevents it from being worn down by Toxic. Body Press allows it to capitalize on Iron Defense further and hit extremely hard. Leftovers provides passive recovery to lessen the need to use Rest, but Chesto Berry can be used for a free Rest and to have an easier time snowballing. Runerigus is completely walled by opposing Ghost-types like Froslass and Haunter with this set, so it benefits from Dark-types like Scrafty and Absol to pressure them. Weezing can spread burns to give Runerigus more setup opportunities and use Toxic Spikes to prevent Ghost-types like Palossand and Gourgeist from stalling it out. Fighting-types like Passimian and Gallade can check opposing Dark- and Ice-types like Absol and Arctovish and draw in bulky Pokemon like Quagsire and Sandaconda that Runerigus can use as setup fodder. Runerigus is also vulnerable to Pokemon such as Tsareena and Choice Specs Whimsicott that can break past it before it can boost high enough, so offensive checks to them like Charizard and Silvally-Steel are appreciated.

sets.name: Belly Drum
sets.description:
Eiscue's unique Ability in Ice Face and access to Belly Drum make it a threatening, albeit matchup dependent, late-game sweeper. Reversal is an 80-Base Power attack after Eiscue uses Substitute and Belly Drum, providing great neutral coverage alongside Eiscue's Ice STAB and letting it take down Steel-type Pokemon it otherwise couldn't, such as Mawile, Pawniard, and Klang, as well as Lapras. Zen Headbutt sacrifices hitting those target in order to cover Mareanie, which otherwise walls Eiscue. Liquidation is a niche option that deals more damage to the aforementioned targets before Eiscue is set up. Substitute provides Eiscue with protection from status and revenge killing, and lets it activate its Salac Berry after using Belly Drum, outspeeding most of the unboosted metagame even if Ice Face hasn't been activated and outrunning even the fastest boosted Pokemon, like Choice Scarf Manectric and Quick Feet Galarian Linoone, if it has been activated. Belly Drum brings Eiscue's otherwise mediocre Attack stat to ridiculous levels, making it vital to sweeping. A Jolly nature with maximum Speed investment is used to let Eiscue outspeed fast Pokemon like Leafeon and Silvally at +1 if Ice Face isn't activated.

Eiscue fits best on offensive teams that can break through its defensive answers. If Eiscue isn't running Zen Headbutt, teammates that can take on Mareanie are absolutely vital. Good examples of these teammates include Electric-type Pokemon like Manectric and Raichu and Psychic-type Pokemon like Mr. Mime, Musharna, and Mr. Rime, the latter of which can also remove entry hazards. Roselia can use Spikes or Toxic Spikes to help wear down the opponent's defensive backbone, check Water-types, put opposing Pokemon to sleep to provide Eiscue with more setup opportunities, and removes Toxic Spikes, which would otherwise shut Eiscue down. If Eiscue isn't running Reversal, teammates that can take on Steel-types are important. Falinks and Hitmontop are good at pressuring foes like Mawile, Klang, and Pawniard offensively, with Falinks fitting very well on hyper offense and Hitmontop offering hazard removal and reliable priority. The aforementioned Psychic-types are also great options for wearing down Steel-types, as most teams rely on those Pokemon to take them on, with Mr. Rime, Mr. Mime, and Musharna giving Eiscue a safe switch and a second chance at setting up via Healing Wish. Pivots such as the aforementioned Electric-type Pokemon, Silvally formes, and Drakloak can be useful for getting Eiscue on the field safely against Pokemon that it threatens, like Roselia, or that can't bypass Ice Face, as is the case for most physical attackers lacking Knock Off. Stonjourner makes for a strong lead option on offense that can provide Stealth Rock support and threaten several of Eiscue's answers with Earthquake. Other setup sweepers, like Fraxure, Pawniard, and the previously mentioned Falinks and Raichu, are effective at softening the opponent's defensive backbone for Eiscue. Wallbreakers like Swords Dance Mawile, Throh, and Choice Band Fraxure are effective teammates for the same purpose, with the former two being able to use Knock Off on sturdy answers to Eiscue, like Mareanie and Klang, that rely on their Eviolite to function effectively.

Arctovish.overview: With unique access to the powerful Fishious Rend, Arctovish carves itself a niche as a powerful Water-type wallbreaker that can decimate all but the bulkiest Water-resistant Pokemon. Its solid coverage in Crunch and Psychic Fangs allows it to hit standard Water-immune Pokemon, such as Water Absorb Jellicent and Toxicroak. Its additional Ice typing offers coverage against Grass- and Dragon-types such as Tangela and Drudiggon, which can otherwise switch into Fishious Rend at least once and force it out. However, Arctovish has a bad defensive typing with weaknesses to common Fighting- and Grass-type moves, a weakness to Stealth Rock, and no relevant resistances, barring a Water immunity via Water Absorb. This limits its ability to get in and actually begin to wallbreak. It also relies on correct prediction to make progress and cannot do much versus bulky Water-types that aren't weak to its coverage, like Pyukumuku.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description: Crunch allows Arctovish to hit Jellicent, which can otherwise safely switch into both of its STAB moves even without Water Absorb and threaten to burn it. Psychic Fangs OHKOes Toxicroak and 2HKOes Poliwrath, which hold Water immunites thanks to their respective abilities. An Adamant nature gives Arctovish the most possible power, but a Jolly nature is useful for outspeeding Jolly Aggron. Arctovish hates entry hazards such as Stealth Rock on its side, so it should be paired with Defoggers or deterrents such as Charizard and Xatu. Charizard is able to bait in and cripple bulky Water-types with Toxic, making them easier to wear down, and switch into Grass-types such as Whimsicott, while Xatu can provide momentum with Teleport and extra damage with Future Sight. Arctovish loves entry hazards on the opposing side, though, to further chip down its checks, so partners such as Accelgor and Garbodor are recommended. Garbodor is also able to switch into Fighting-types such as Passimian. Offensive Grass-types such as Whimsicott and Tsareena are solid partners. They are able to threaten out bulky Water-types such as Jellicent and Lanturn, while Arctovish is able to hit Fire- and Steel-types such as Charizard and Silvally-Steel, which both Grass-types can pivot it into.
